properties.headline: High Wind Watch issued January 14 at 3:25AM PST until January 16 at 10:00AM PST by NWS Reno NV
properties.description:
* CHANGES...Added a High Wind Watch for a southerly wind event
anticipated Wednesday night into Thursday morning. No changes
for the ongoing event.

* WHAT...For the High Wind Warning, southwest winds 25 to 35 mph
with gusts 50 to 65 mph. For the High Wind Watch, south winds 20
to 30 mph with gusts of 50 to 65 mph possible.

* WHERE...Greater Reno-Carson City-Minden Area.

* WHEN...For the High Wind Warning, until 10 AM PST this
morning. For the High Wind Watch, from Wednesday evening
through Thursday morning.

* IMPACTS...Damaging winds could blow down trees, fences, and
power lines. Power outages are possible. Travel will be
difficult, especially for high profile vehicles. Severe
turbulence and delays for air travel.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Brief light snow showers remain possible
through this morning with could result in slick spots for the
morning commute.
properties.instruction:
Now is the time Secure loose outdoor items such as patio
furniture, holiday decorations, and trash cans before winds
increase which could blow these items away. The best thing to do
is prepare ahead of time by making sure you have extra food and
water on hand, flashlights with spare batteries and/or candles in
the event of a power outage.

NWSheadline: HIGH WIND WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM PST THIS MORNING... ...HIGH WIND WATCH IN EFFECT FROM WEDNESDAY EVENING THROUGH THURSDAY MORNING
